clauses-english.clause: The Inevitable Reality -
What is the Inevitable Reality?

5326.verse-english: And what can make you know what is the Inevitable Reality?

clauses-english.clause: And what can make you know what is the Inevitable Reality?

5327.verse-english: Thamud and 'Aad denied the Striking Calamity.

clauses-english.clause: Thamud and 'Aad denied the Striking Calamity.

5328.verse-english: So as for Thamud, they were destroyed by the overpowering [blast].

clauses-english.clause: So as for Thamud,
they were destroyed by the overpowering [blast].

5329.verse-arabic: وَأَمَّا عَادٌ فَأُهْلِكُوا بِرِيحٍ صَرْصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٍ
5329.verse-english: And as for 'Aad, they were destroyed by a screaming, violent wind

clauses-english.clause: And as for 'Aad,
they were destroyed by a screaming,
violent wind

5330.verse-arabic: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيْهِمْ سَبْعَ لَيَالٍ وَثَمَانِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومًا فَتَرَى الْقَوْمَ فِيهَا صَرْعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ خَاوِيَةٍ
5330.verse-english: Which Allah imposed upon them for seven nights and eight days in succession, so you would see the people therein fallen as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.

clauses-english.clause: Which God imposed upon them for seven nights and eight days in succession,
so you would see the people therein fallen as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.

5331.verse-english: Then do you see of them any remains?

clauses-english.clause: Then do you see of them any remains?

5332.verse-arabic: وَجَاءَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَن قَبْلَهُ وَالْمُؤْتَفِكَاتُ بِالْخَاطِئَةِ
5332.verse-english: And there came Pharaoh and those before him and the overturned cities with sin.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَجَاءَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَن قَبْلَهُ وَالْمُؤْتَفِكَاتُ بِالْخَاطِئَةِ

clauses-english.clause: And there came Pharaoh and those before him and the overturned cities with sin.

5333.verse-arabic: فَعَصَوْا رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَهُمْ أَخْذَةً رَّابِيَةً
5333.verse-english: And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with a seizure exceeding [in severity].

clauses-english.clause: And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord,
so He seized them with a seizure exceeding [in severity].

5334.verse-arabic: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَى الْمَاءُ حَمَلْنَاكُمْ فِي الْجَارِيَةِ
5334.verse-english: Indeed, when the water overflowed, We carried your ancestors in the sailing ship

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
when the water overflowed,
We carried your ancestors in the sailing ship

5335.verse-arabic: لِنَجْعَلَهَا لَكُمْ تَذْكِرَةً وَتَعِيَهَا أُذُنٌ وَاعِيَةٌ
5335.verse-english: That We might make it for you a reminder and [that] a conscious ear would be conscious of it.

clauses-arabic.clause: لِنَجْعَلَهَا لَكُمْ تَذْكِرَةً وَتَعِيَهَا أُذُنٌ وَاعِيَةٌ

clauses-english.clause: That We might make it for you a reminder and [that] a conscious ear would be conscious of it.

5336.verse-arabic: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ نَفْخَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ
5336.verse-english: Then when the Horn is blown with one blast

clauses-arabic.clause: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ نَفْخَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ

clauses-english.clause: Then when the Horn is blown with one blast

5337.verse-arabic: وَحُمِلَتِ الْأَرْضُ وَالْجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةً وَاحِدَةً
5337.verse-english: And the earth and the mountains are lifted and leveled with one blow -

clauses-arabic.clause: وَحُمِلَتِ الْأَرْضُ وَالْجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةً وَاحِدَةً

clauses-english.clause: And the earth and the mountains are lifted and leveled with one blow -

5338.verse-english: Then on that Day, the Resurrection will occur,

clauses-english.clause: Then on that Day,
the Resurrection will occur,

5339.verse-english: And the heaven will split [open], for that Day it is infirm.

clauses-english.clause: And the heaven will split [open],
for that Day it is infirm.

5340.verse-arabic: وَالْمَلَكُ عَلَىٰ أَرْجَائِهَا ۚ وَيَحْمِلُ عَرْشَ رَبِّكَ فَوْقَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ ثَمَانِيَةٌ
5340.verse-english: And the angels are at its edges. And there will bear the Throne of your Lord above them, that Day, eight [of them].

clauses-english.clause: And the angels are at its edges.
And there will bear the Throne of your Lord above them,
that Day,
eight [of them].

5341.verse-arabic: يَوْمَئِذٍ تُعْرَضُونَ لَا تَخْفَىٰ مِنكُمْ خَافِيَةٌ
5341.verse-english: That Day, you will be exhibited [for judgement]; not hidden among you is anything concealed.

clauses-english.clause: That Day,
you will be exhibited [for judgement];
not hidden among you is anything concealed.

5342.verse-arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ بِيَمِينِهِ فَيَقُولُ هَاؤُمُ اقْرَءُوا كِتَابِيَهْ
5342.verse-english: So as for he who is given his record in his right hand, he will say, "Here, read my record!

clauses-english.clause: So as for he who is given his record in his right hand,
he will say,
"Here,
read my record!

5343.verse-english: Indeed, I was certain that I would be meeting my account."

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
I was certain that I would be meeting my account.

5344.verse-english: So he will be in a pleasant life -

clauses-english.clause: So he will be in a pleasant life -
In an elevated garden,

5346.verse-english: Its [fruit] to be picked hanging near.

clauses-english.clause: Its [fruit] to be picked hanging near.

5347.verse-arabic: كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا هَنِيئًا بِمَا أَسْلَفْتُمْ فِي الْأَيَّامِ الْخَالِيَةِ
5347.verse-english: [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you put forth in the days past."

clauses-english.clause: [They will be told],
"Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you put forth in the days past.

5348.verse-arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ بِشِمَالِهِ فَيَقُولُ يَا لَيْتَنِي لَمْ أُوتَ كِتَابِيَهْ
5348.verse-english: But as for he who is given his record in his left hand, he will say, "Oh, I wish I had not been given my record

clauses-english.clause: But as for he who is given his record in his left hand,
he will say,
"Oh,
I wish I had not been given my record

5349.verse-english: And had not known what is my account.

clauses-english.clause: And had not known what is my account.

5350.verse-english: I wish my death had been the decisive one.

clauses-english.clause: I wish my death had been the decisive one.

5351.verse-english: My wealth has not availed me.

clauses-english.clause: My wealth has not availed me.

5352.verse-english: Gone from me is my authority."

clauses-english.clause: Gone from me is my authority.

5353.verse-english: [Allah will say], "Seize him and shackle him.

clauses-english.clause: [God will say],
"Seize him and shackle him.
Then into Hellfire drive him.

5355.verse-arabic: ثُمَّ فِي سِلْسِلَةٍ ذَرْعُهَا سَبْعُونَ ذِرَاعًا فَاسْلُكُوهُ
5355.verse-english: Then into a chain whose length is seventy cubits insert him."

clauses-english.clause: Then into a chain whose length is seventy cubits insert him.

5356.verse-arabic: إِنَّهُ كَانَ لَا يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ الْعَظِيمِ
5356.verse-english: Indeed, he did not used to believe in Allah, the Most Great,

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
he did not used to believe in God,
the Most Great,

5357.verse-english: Nor did he encourage the feeding of the poor.

clauses-english.clause: Nor did he encourage the feeding of the poor.

5358.verse-english: So there is not for him here this Day any devoted friend

clauses-english.clause: So there is not for him here this Day any devoted friend

5359.verse-english: Nor any food except from the discharge of wounds;

clauses-english.clause: Nor any food except from the discharge of wounds;

5360.verse-english: None will eat it except the sinners.

clauses-english.clause: None will eat it except the sinners.

5361.verse-english: So I swear by what you see

clauses-english.clause: So I swear by what you see

5362.verse-english: And what you do not see

clauses-english.clause: And what you do not see

5363.verse-english: [That] indeed, the Qur'an is the word of a noble Messenger.

clauses-english.clause: [That] indeed,
the Qur'an is the word of a noble Messenger.

5364.verse-arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَاعِرٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تُؤْمِنُونَ
5364.verse-english: And it is not the word of a poet; little do you believe.

clauses-english.clause: And it is not the word of a poet;
little do you believe.

5365.verse-arabic: وَلَا بِقَوْلِ كَاهِنٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
5365.verse-english: Nor the word of a soothsayer; little do you remember.

clauses-english.clause: Nor the word of a soothsayer;
little do you remember.

5366.verse-english: [It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.

clauses-english.clause: [It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.

5367.verse-english: And if Muhammad had made up about Us some [false] sayings,

clauses-english.clause: And if Muhammad had made up about Us some [false] sayings,

5368.verse-english: We would have seized him by the right hand;

clauses-english.clause: We would have seized him by the right hand;

5369.verse-english: Then We would have cut from him the aorta.

clauses-english.clause: Then We would have cut from him the aorta.

5370.verse-arabic: فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنْ أَحَدٍ عَنْهُ حَاجِزِينَ
5370.verse-english: And there is no one of you who could prevent [Us] from him.

clauses-arabic.clause: فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنْ أَحَدٍ عَنْهُ حَاجِزِينَ

clauses-english.clause: And there is no one of you who could prevent [Us] from him.

5371.verse-english: And indeed, the Qur'an is a reminder for the righteous.

clauses-english.clause: And indeed,
the Qur'an is a reminder for the righteous.

5372.verse-english: And indeed, We know that among you are deniers.

clauses-english.clause: And indeed,
We know that among you are deniers.

5373.verse-english: And indeed, it will be [a cause of] regret upon the disbelievers.

clauses-english.clause: And indeed,
it will be [a cause of] regret upon the disbelievers.

5374.verse-english: And indeed, it is the truth of certainty.

clauses-english.clause: And indeed,
it is the truth of certainty.

5375.verse-english: So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.

clauses-english.clause: So exalt the name of your Lord,
the Most Great.
